abstract: Harley-Davidson, Honda Motor and Bank of America are leading about $9.5 billion of debt offerings for the Federal Reserve’s program to encourage lending, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: Harley-Davidson, Honda Motor and Bank of America are leading about $9.5 billion of debt offerings for the Federal Reserve’s program to encourage lending, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Harley-Davidson, Honda Motor and Bank of America are leading about $9.5 billion of debt offerings for the Federal Reserve’s program to encourage lending, people with knowledge of the sales told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Harley, Honda and BofA Said to Lead Bond Sale
